definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Wink at small faults; remember thousand has great ones.
sentences.chinese: 若对小错误视而不见，那你就会犯大错。

sentences.english: Goverments are blind to evils of smoking too.
sentences.chinese: 政府对吸烟的恶果也是视而不见。

sentences.english: Paraphrase: Those who are blind to the absurd that is to be easily noticed propably are the civilized.
sentences.chinese: 对明显荒诞却又视而不见的，常是那些文明人。

sentences.english: Ginger sinus instructors to turn a blind eye to my temper attitude.
sentences.chinese: 姜窦对教官们对本人的视而不见态度大为光火。

sentences.english: R26; But the tendency to simplify blinds them to other alternatives.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种简化倾向会他们对于其他的可选项视而不见。

sentences.english: We must not wink at his error.
sentences.chinese: 可是艾莱柯对这种暗示视而不见。

sentences.english: A flocking bird is blind to the grace and cohesiveness of a flock in flight.
sentences.chinese: 结队飞行的鸟对飞行姿势和凝聚力是视而不见的。

sentences.english: To all the backward-looking critics, none of this matters.
sentences.chinese: 但所有批评者对这些都视而不见。

sentences.english: Indeed, many students have a sort inborn blindness to its possibility.
sentences.chinese: 的确，很多学生天生就对这种可能视而不见。

sentences.english: He was open now to charges of wilful blindness.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他对指控对问题视而不见睁一眼闭一眼。

sentences.english: Lastly, it ignores overwhelming evidence to contrary.
sentences.chinese: 最后，它对强有力的反面证据视而不见。

sentences.english: Some government officials connive at graft.
sentences.chinese: 有些政府官员对贪污受贿视而不见。

sentences.english: He looked vaguely before him with unseeing eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他迷迷糊糊的望着前面，对一切都视而不见。

sentences.english: My silly boy, I've always loved you, even if you turn a blind eye.
sentences.chinese: 我的傻孩子，我一直爱你，即使你视而不见。

sentences.english: Some governments are still closing their eyes to infections in high-risk groups.
sentences.chinese: 一些政府现在依然对高危人群中的感染情况视而不见。

sentences.english: Why did you give me the go -by in the street yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么昨天在街上对我视而不见，形同陌路？

definition: to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to turn a blind eye to
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to ignore/to disregard
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
accustomed to/used to
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
